genitalia which have been described 
<s>by<\s> as arteries.
The upper end of the band passes to the 
<s>uppe <\s> sinuses of the upper lobe of the mantle 
& comes into the same relation with 
the genitalia which they inclose.
The walls of the auricle in <u>Waldheimia <\u> are 
curiously plaited but I have been unable 
in either auricle or ventricle to detect any such arrangement of muscular 
fibres <s>in them <\s> as that which has been 
described - The epithelial investment 
of the auricle, on the other hand, is well 
developed & in the ventricle the 
corresponding inner coat is raised up 
into rounded villous eminences -
The ventricle lies in the thickness of 
the parietes while the auricle floats in 
the visceral cavity supported only by 
the ilio parietal band - The former
